sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Richard of Wetheringsett, Hugh of Saint-Victor OSA, Alanus ab Insula (Alain de Lille), Petrus Comestor, Remigius of Auxerre and Glossarium
Qui Bene Praesunt. Hugo de S. Victore. Glossarium
msDesc.p: Vellum, 272 171 10.5 x 6.7, ff. 79 + 30 + 42, three volumes of cent. xiv, xiii and ix?.

Volume I: Double columns of 30 lines, large upright hand.
Volume II: Double columns of 46 lines, two hands, both good, of cent. xiii early: the second is the larger.
Volume III: Double columns of 29 lines, initials in red, in a fine insular hand.
Collation: 112-612 78 (wants 8) || I8-IV8 (wants 7, 8) | a6 b8 c8 d4-f4 g8.

msItem.head: Richard of Wetheringsett, Summa Qui bene praesunt

head.title: Tractatus magistri R. [Ricardi Wetherseti] cancellarii de Cantebruge qui dicitur numerale

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri R. cancellarii de cantebruge qui dicitur numerale
msItem.incipit: Qui bene presunt presbiteri duplici honore digni habeantur
msItem.rubric: Explicit summa magistri Ricardi cancellarii de cantebruge que numerale dicitur
msItem.ab: Ascribed in MS 337. 5 to William de Montibus

msItem.head: Hugh of Saint-Victor OSA, De institutione nouiciorum

head.title: Tractatus magistri Hugonis de Sancto Victore de disciplina

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus magistri hugonis de sancto uictore de disciplina
msItem.incipit: Quia fratres largiente domino de uana conuersatione
msItem.explicit: interim nos diximus bonitatem uero orate ut uobis det deus amen

msItem.head: Alanus ab Insula (Alain de Lille), De sex alis cherubim

head.title: Alanus de Insula or Clement of Lanthony de sex alis cherubim

msItem.rubric: De vi alis quibus anima uolat ad deum, etc.
msItem.incipit: Prima ala est confessio non laudis

msItem.head: Petrus Comestor, Sententiae de sacramentis
msItem.incipit: Tractaturi de sacramentis uideamus quid sit sacramentum
msItem.explicit: ligandi et soluendi quia ueros non habet sacerdotes

msItem.head: Remigius of Auxerre, Expositio missae (interpolated)

head.title: Expositio in celebratione missae a Remigio Altisiodorensi edita et sanctorum patrum summis et autoritate comfirmata

msItem.rubric: Incipit e(x)positio in celebratione misse a Remigio altisiodorensi edita et sanctorum patrum sententiis et auctoritate confirmata
msItem.explicit: ecce agnus dei ecce qui tollit peccata mundi

head.title: Dictionarium quoddam seu explicatio vocum Latinarum difficiliorum

msItem.ab: Glossary.I have not succeeded in identifying this text.
msItem.incipit:
Abba Pater
Ab iiulius mensis
Ab augustus mensis
Abdico alieno. respuo

ab.decoNote: Fine initial in outline with patches of blue: interlaced lines discontinued at the intersections

msItem.ab: A few early additions, and some in a hand of cent. xii. One such addition (in letter I - f. 125r) is Ymera. dies secundum vlvricum. Sperma semen

ab.handNote: The hand seems to change near the beginning of M

msItem.ab: In the lower margin of f. 20r in a hand of cent. xi (?) is the Sanctus with neumes

ab.decoNote: Initial to letter N in green (f. 130v). O in blue with a face (f. 131v)

msItem.ab:
Presagi diuini presciui futurorum
Pressant premunt
(added) Pubes barba iuvenum
msItem.incipit:
Actis factis
Alumnis dilectis famulis uel seruis
Attonitis intentis
Ammonet rogat commonet
msItem.ab:
Abagreca ethimologia
a uescendo uocabulum
sumpsit quasi fuga. fage
enim grece dicitur comedere
Adhibens consentiens prestans
Albanum sucus de ferola

Prescelides armillas pedum mulierum
The insertion occupies two half-columns
The vellum of the 4-leaved quires (d, e, f) is very thick
msItem.explicit:
Zografia pictura uel pictor
Zós uita
Zonarim cingulum
Zelotipia dicitur foror cum rancore mentis accensus fuerit
msItem.ab:
(A)leph mille uel doctrina
...
(T)au mata dona concede
ris ene prope
o liuore uulnere
(C)onsulere percunctare
(U)surpat usu inlicita habet
On 42v in a sloping hand, a receipt
Ad omnes tumores. uentris. renium (?). lumborum. coxarum, etc. ... Dicitur autem glutis taurina
Sancte Caterine festum vacat et S. Andree et omnium apostolorum et ante omnes omnia S. Marie festa et S. Nicholai
